    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String strWeather 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NWSFB(java.lang.String strVar)
      This construtor function sets a line of airport weather to the private class variable, strWeather, for use in this class.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getAltitudeWeather(java.lang.String strAlt)
      This public function will call getpos to determine where to start extracting seven characters from the class level variable containing the station weather.
      private int getPos(java.lang.String strAlt)
      This private function accepts a string called strAlt representing an altitude and returns an integer representing the starting character position of the altitude weather in the station weather string by use of a switch statement for all of the 9 altitudes
      java.lang.String getStationID(java.lang.String strAlt) 
      java.lang.String getWindDirection(java.lang.String strAlt)
      This function will call getAltitudeWeather and extract the first two characters and concatenate a zero to the return value to show the user the direction in degrees that the wind is coming from
      java.lang.String getWindSpeed(java.lang.String strAlt)
      This calls the method, getAltitudeWeather extract the 3nd and 4th characters of the strWeather string.
      java.lang.String getWindTemp(java.lang.String strAlt)
      This public method calls the method, getAltitudeWeather to extract final characters of the stationWeather string.

      • strWeather

        private java.lang.String strWeather

    • Constructor Detail

      • NWSFB

        public NWSFB(java.lang.String strVar)
        This construtor function sets a line of airport weather to the private class variable, strWeather, for use in this class.
        Parameters:
        strVar - a line of weather for an airport

    • Method Detail

      • getStationID

        public java.lang.String getStationID(java.lang.String strAlt)

      • getPos

        private int getPos(java.lang.String strAlt)
        This private function accepts a string called strAlt representing an altitude and returns an integer representing the starting character position of the altitude weather in the station weather string by use of a switch statement for all of the 9 altitudes
        Parameters:
        strAlt - Altitude in thousands as a string
        Returns:
        an integer representing the character postion with the strWeather string

      • getAltitudeWeather

        public java.lang.String getAltitudeWeather(java.lang.String strAlt)
        This public function will call getpos to determine where to start extracting seven characters from the class level variable containing the station weather.
        Parameters:
        strAlt - - string representing altitude in thousands of feet.
        Returns:
        seven character string representing the altitude weather.

      • getWindDirection

        public java.lang.String getWindDirection(java.lang.String strAlt)
        This function will call getAltitudeWeather and extract the first two characters and concatenate a zero to the return value to show the user the direction in degrees that the wind is coming from
        Parameters:
        strAlt - String representing altitude in thousands of feet.
        Returns:
        windDir String representing wind direction at the specified altitude in degrees.

      • getWindSpeed

        public java.lang.String getWindSpeed(java.lang.String strAlt)
        This calls the method, getAltitudeWeather extract the 3nd and 4th characters of the strWeather string. The method returns them as the wind speed at the specified altitude.
        Parameters:
        strAlt - Altitude in thousands as a string
        Returns:
        windSpeed The wind speed at the specified altitude in knots

      • getWindTemp

        public java.lang.String getWindTemp(java.lang.String strAlt)
        This public method calls the method, getAltitudeWeather to extract final characters of the stationWeather string. The method returns them as the temperature at the specified altitude.
        Parameters:
        strAlt - Altitude in thousands as a string
        Returns:
        windTemp The temperature of the air at the specified altitude
